verses.sanskrit:
ततो युद्धपरिश्रान्तं समरे चिन्तया स्थितम्।
रावणं चाग्रतो दृष्ट्वा युद्धाय समुपस्थितम्॥
दैवतैश्च समागम्य द्रष्टुमभ्यागतो रणम्।
उपगम्याब्रवीद्राममगस्त्यो भगवानृषिः॥
verses.transliteration:
tato yuddhapar iśrāntaṃ samare cintayā sthitam।
rāvaṇaṃ cāgrato dṛṣṭvā yuddhāya samupasthitam॥
daivataiśca samāgamya draṣṭumabhyāgato raṇam।
upagamyābravīdrāmamagastyo bhagavānṛṣiḥ॥
verses.meaning: Then, seeing Rama exhausted from battle and standing thoughtful, with Ravana ready for war before him, the divine sage Agastya, who had come with the gods to witness the battle, approached Rama and said...

verses.sanskrit:
राम राम महाबाहो श्रृणु गुह्यं सनातनम्।
येन सर्वानरीन्वत्स समरे विजयिष्यसि॥
आदित्यहृदयं पुण्यं सर्वशत्रुविनाशनम्।
जयावहं जपेन्नित्यमक्षय्यं परमं शिवम्॥
verses.transliteration:
rāma rāma mahābāho śṛṇu guhyaṃ sanātanam।
yena sarvānarīnvatsa samare vijayiṣyasi॥
ādityahṛdayaṃ puṇyaṃ sarvaśatruvināśanam।
jayāvahaṃ japennityamakṣayyaṃ paramaṃ śivam॥
verses.meaning: O mighty-armed Rama, listen to this eternal secret by which, O child, you shall conquer all your enemies in battle. This is the holy Aditya Hridayam, destroyer of all foes, bestower of victory, eternal and supremely auspicious. Recite it always.

verses.sanskrit:
आदित्यं प्रेक्ष्य जपत्वेतत्परं हर्षमवाप्स्यसि।
सर्वमङ्गलमाङ्गल्यं सर्वपापप्रणाशनम्।
अङ्गारकाय वन्देऽहं सूर्यं सर्वभयापहम्॥
verses.transliteration:
ādityaṃ prekṣya japat vetetparaṃ harṣamavāpsyasi।
sarvamaṅgalamāṅgalyaṃ sarvapāpapraṇāśanam।
aṅgārākāya vande'haṃ sūryaṃ sarvabhayāpaham॥
verses.meaning: Looking at the Sun and reciting this, you shall obtain supreme joy. It is the most auspicious of the auspicious, destroyer of all sins. I salute the Sun, the remover of all fears.

verses.sanskrit:
सूर्य सूर्य महासूर्य सर्वसूर्य नमोऽस्तु ते।
नमः पूर्वाय गिरये पश्चिमायाद्रये नमः॥
ज्योतिर्गणानां पतये दिनाधिपतये नमः।
जयाय जयभद्राय हर्यश्वाय नमो नमः॥
verses.transliteration:
sūrya sūrya mahāsūrya sarvasūrya namo'stu te।
namaḥ pūrvāya giraye paścimāyādraye namaḥ॥
jyotirgaṇānāṃ pataye dinādhipataye namaḥ।
jayāya jayabhadrāya haryaśvāya namo namaḥ॥
verses.meaning: O Sun, O great Sun, O supreme Sun, salutations to You! Salutations to the eastern mountain (where you rise) and to the western mountain (where you set). Salutations to the lord of all luminaries, the ruler of the day. Salutations to the victorious one, the giver of victory and auspiciousness, the one with green horses.

verses.sanskrit:
नमो नमः सहस्रांशो आदित्याय नमो नमः।
नमः शिवाय सत्याय हरये परमात्मने॥
नमश्चण्डाय धूमोर्णे जगत्प्रतिष्ठाय ते नमः।
नमस्तमोभिनाशाय रुचये लोकसाक्षिणे॥
verses.transliteration:
namo namaḥ sahasrāṃśo ādityāya namo namaḥ।
namaḥ śivāya satyāya haraye paramātmane॥
namaścaṇḍāya dhūmorṇe jagatpratiṣṭhāya te namaḥ।
namastamobhināśāya rucaye lokasākṣiṇe॥
verses.meaning: Salutations to the thousand-rayed one, salutations to Aditya (son of Aditi). Salutations to the auspicious one, the truth, destroyer of darkness, the supreme Self. Salutations to the fierce one with smoky rays, the support of the universe. Salutations to the destroyer of darkness, the radiant one, the witness of the world.

verses.sanskrit:
नाशयत्येष वै भूतं तदेव सृजति प्रभुः।
पायत्येष तपत्येष वर्षत्येष गभस्तिभिः॥
एष सुप्तेषु जागर्ति भूतेषु परिनिष्ठितः।
एष एवाग्निहोत्रं च फलं चैवाग्निहोत्रिणाम्॥
verses.transliteration:
nāśayatyeṣa vai bhūtaṃ tadeva sṛjati prabhuḥ।
pāyatyeṣa tapatyeṣa varṣatyeṣa gabhastibhiḥ॥
eṣa supteṣu jāgarti bhūteṣu pariniṣṭhitaḥ।
eṣa evāgnihotraṃ ca phalaṃ caivāgnihotriṇām॥
verses.meaning: This Lord destroys all beings and creates them again. He protects, He heats, He causes rain through His rays. He remains awake in all sleeping beings, established in all creatures. He alone is the sacred fire ritual (Agnihotra) and the fruit of those who perform it.

verses.sanskrit:
वेदाश्च क्रतवश्चैव क्रतूनां फलमेव च।
यानि कृत्यानि लोकेषु सर्वेषु परमप्रभुः॥
एनमापत्सु कृच्छ्रेषु कान्तारेषु भयेषु च।
कीर्तयन्पुरुषः कश्चिन्नावसीदति राघव॥
verses.transliteration:
vedāśca kratavaścaiva kratūnāṃ phalameva ca।
yāni kṛtyāni lokeṣu sarveṣu paramaprabhuḥ॥
enamāpatsu kṛcchreṣu kāntāreṣu bhayeṣu ca।
kīrtayanpuruṣaḥ kaścin nāvasīdati rāghava॥
verses.meaning: He is the Vedas, the sacrifices, and the fruits of all sacrifices. He is the supreme Lord of all actions in all worlds. O Raghava, any person who glorifies Him in difficulties, troubles, in forests and in dangers, shall never perish.

verses.sanskrit:
पूजयस्वैनमेकाग्रो देवदेवं जगत्पतिम्।
एतत्त्रिगुणितं जप्त्वा युद्धेषु विजयिष्यसि॥
अस्मिन्क्षणे महाबाहो रावणं त्वं जहि मृधे।
एवमुक्त्वा ततोऽगस्त्यो जगाम च यथागतम्॥
verses.transliteration:
pūjayasvainamekāgro devadevaṃ jagatpatim।
etattriguṇitaṃ japtvā yudd heṣu vijayiṣyasi॥
asminkṣaṇe mahābāho rāvaṇaṃ tvaṃ jahi mṛdhe।
evamuktvā tato'gastyo jagāma ca yathāgatam॥
verses.meaning: Worship Him with one-pointed mind, the God of gods, the Lord of the universe. Reciting this thrice, you shall be victorious in battles. At this very moment, O mighty-armed one, slay Ravana in combat. Having said thus, sage Agastya departed as he had come.

verses.sanskrit:
एतच्छ्रुत्वा महातेजा नष्टशोकोऽभवत्तदा।
धारयामास सुप्रीतो राघवः प्रयतात्मवान्॥
आदित्यं प्रेक्ष्य जप्त्वेदं परं हर्षमवाप्तवान्।
त्रिराचम्य शुचिर्भूत्वा धनुरादाय वीर्यवान्॥
verses.transliteration:
etaccchrutvā mahātejā naṣṭaśoko'bhavattadā।
dhārayāmāsa suprito rāghavaḥ prayatātmavān॥
ādityaṃ prekṣya japtvedaṃ paraṃ harṣamavāptavān।
trirācamya śucirbhūtvā dhanurādāya vīryavān॥
verses.meaning: Hearing this, the greatly radiant Rama became free from sorrow. The self-controlled Raghava held it with great pleasure. Looking at the Sun and reciting this, he attained supreme joy. Sipping water thrice and becoming purified, the valorous one took up his bow.

verses.sanskrit:
रावणं प्रेक्ष्य हृष्टात्मा जयार्थे समुपागतः।
सर्वयत्नेन महता वधे तस्य धृतोऽभवत्॥
अथ रविरवदन्निरीक्ष्य रामं मुदितमनाः परमं प्रहृष्यमाणः।
निशिचरपतिसंक्षयं विदित्वा सुरगणमध्यगतो वचस्त्वरेति॥
verses.transliteration:
rāvaṇaṃ prekṣya hṛṣṭātmā jayārthe samupāgataḥ।
sarvayatnena mahatā vadhe tasya dhṛto'bhavat॥
atha raviravadan nirīkṣya rāmaṃ muditamanāḥ paramaṃ prahṛṣyamāṇaḥ।
niśicarapatisaṃkṣayaṃ viditvā suragaṇamadhyagato vacastvareti॥
verses.meaning: Seeing Ravana, with delighted heart, he approached for victory. With all great effort, he became fixed on his destruction. Then the Sun God, observing Rama with joyful mind and extremely pleased, knowing the destruction of the lord of night-wanderers was near, said from amidst the host of gods: 'Hurry!'
